rationale: No intensifier or comparative directly modifies a risk-adjective.
The segment uses neutral language describing experimental results ('placed in', 'could touch, nose and lick', 'became ill').
The segment reports on study methods and results ('all of them became ill').
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The segment reports a negative outcome from a study (all became ill) without explicit calming language.
No minimiser or scale contrast found.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
The segment describes an experimental procedure and outcome, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment reports numerical metrics 'three healthy ferrets', 'three of the sick animals' using standard verbs.
